clinical_study.brief_title: PK Study to Assess Drug-drug Interaction Between Sitravatinib and a Cocktail of Substrates
clinical_study.official_title: Two-part, Phase 1, Multicenter, Open-label, Fixed-sequence, Drug-Drug Interaction Study to Investigate the Effect of Sitravatinib on Probe Substrates Followed by Combination Treatment With Nivolumab in Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: Study 516-010 is an open-label Phase 1, drug-drug interaction study evaluating the effect of sitravatinib on probe substrates for CYP450 enzymes and BCRP and P-gp transporters.

detailed_description.textblock:
Part 1 of this study is designed to evaluate the potential for drug-drug interactions with sitravatinib monotherapy when administered with probe drugs for specific cytochrome P450 (CYP) enzymes (CYP2C9, CYP2D6, and CYP3A4) and P-glycoprotein (P-gp) and breast cancer resistance protein (BCRP) transporters
Part 2 allows for patients to continue sitravatinib treatment with the addition of the checkpoint inhibitor Nivolumab.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two Part, Phase enrolling patients with advanced tumor types. All patients receive the same treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of probe drugs (warfarin, dextromethorphan, midazolam, digoxin, and rosuvastatin) derived from the plasma concentration time profile before and after oral administration of sitravatinib
primary_outcome.description: AUC from time zero to the last data point (AUC-last)

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of probe drugs (warfarin, dextromethorphan, midazolam, digoxin, and rosuvastatin) derived from the plasma concentration time profile before and after oral administration of sitravatinib
primary_outcome.description: AUC from time zero to infinity (AUCâˆž)

primary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of probe drugs (warfarin, dextromethorphan, midazolam, digoxin, and rosuvastatin) derived from the plasma concentration time profile before and after oral administration of sitravatinib

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Characterization of AEs by incidence, severity, timing, seriousness & relationship to study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma PK parameters of sitravatinib and M10
Plasma PK parameters of sitravatinib and M10
Plasma PK parameters of sitravatinib and M10
Plasma PK parameters of sitravatinib and M10

secondary_outcome.description: Safety characterized by type, incidence, severity, timing, seriousness & relationship to study treatment of adverse events, and laboratory abnormalities

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in accordance with Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1 and duration of response (DOR)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Phase 1, Part 1 Drug-Drug Interaction with sitravatinib monotherapy
arm_group.description: To evaluate the potential for drug-drug interactions (DDI) with sitravatinib monotherapy. To determine the effect of sitravatinib on the pharmacokinetics (PK) of midazolam (CYP3A4 probe substrate), warfarin (CYP2C9 probe substrate), dextromethorphan (CYP2D6 probe substrate), rosuvastatin (BCRP probe substrate), and digoxin (P-gp probe substrate).
To evaluate safety and tolerability of Sitravatinib treatment with the addition of the checkpoint inhibitor nivolumab.

intervention.description: Sitravatinib is a small molecule inhibitor of receptor tyrosine kinases
intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 1, Part 1 Drug-Drug Interaction with sitravatinib monotherapy
Phase 1, Part 1 Drug-Drug Interaction with sitravatinib monotherapy

intervention.description: Nivolumab is a programmed death receptor (PD-1) blocking antibody

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of unresectable advanced/metastatic solid tumor
- Life expectancy of at least 3 months
- Adequate bone marrow and organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing medical condition or need for treatment with medication that may affect the PK of study treatments during Part 1
- Immunocompromising conditions
- Impaired heart function
- Active or prior documented autoimmune disease
